title: Tiramisu
ingredients: 200ml heavy cream, whipped to soft peaks
instructions: Whisk the egg yolks and sugar together until the mixture becomes pale and creamy.
Gently fold the mascarpone cheese into the egg yolk mixture until fully incorporated.
Add the whipped cream and mix gently until smooth and consistent.
Brew strong coffee and briefly dip the ladyfingers in it, ensuring they are coated but not soggy.
Arrange the dipped ladyfingers in a single layer on a rectangular serving dish.
Spread half of the mascarpone mixture evenly over the first layer of ladyfingers.
Create a second layer by repeating with dipped ladyfingers and covering with the remaining mascarpone mixture.
Dust the top generously with cocoa powder.
Refrigerate the tiramisu for at least 4 hours to set.
Serve and enjoy!

title: Spaghetti
instructions: Chop the onion, and dice the tomatoes.
In a pan, heat olive oil and add the onions.
Add the ground beef and cook until brown.
Add meatballs to the pan (optional).
Add the diced tomatoes and tomato paste
Add the Prego Traditional Pasta Sauce to the pan.
Add sugar, salt, and Italian seasoning to the sauce.
Cook the spaghetti pasta.
Serve the spaghetti with the sauce and top with Parmesan cheese.

title: Banana Bread
instructions: In a large bowl, mash the bananas.
Add sugar in melted butter.
Add mashed bananas to sugar and butter mixture.
Add eggs, vanilla extract, and milk to the mixture.
Slowly pour in the flour, baking soda, and salt while mixing.
Pour the batter into 9 x 5 inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350F for 1 hour or until baked.
Let it cool before serving.

title: French Toast
ingredients: Fresh fruits (e.g., raspberries, blueberries, or your choice), for garnish
instructions: Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat.
Lightly toast the slices of bread until firm but not browned.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs and vanilla extract until well combined.
Dip the slices of bread into the egg mixture, ensuring both sides are evenly coated.
Fry the coated bread slices in the skillet until golden brown on both sides.
Serve warm with maple syrup, whipped cream, and fresh fruits.

title: Panna Cotta
instructions: Prepare the Jello according to the package instructions and pour it into a container.
Refrigerate the Jello for 10 to 20 minutes until slightly set.
In a separate bowl, dissolve the gelatin in the milk and let it bloom for a few minutes.
Heat the mixture gently with cream, honey, vanilla extract, lemon juice, and sugar, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.
Remove from heat and cool the mixture over a bowl of cold water, stirring occasionally.
Pour the cooled mixture gently over the partially set Jello in the container.
Refrigerate again for 10 to 20 minutes, or until fully set.
Serve and enjoy!

title: Doce de Bolacha
instructions: Brew a strong cup of coffee and set it aside.
In a saucepan, whisk together the egg yolks, condensed milk, and coffee, then heat gently until the mixture thickens to a creamy texture.
Transfer the mixture to a container and refrigerate for 15 minutes to cool.
Crush the cookies into small pieces.
Whip the cream with sugar until soft peaks form.
Layer the whipped cream into a serving container.
Sprinkle the crushed cookies on top.
Serve and enjoy!

title: Kani Salad
instructions: Dice the cucumber and carrot in Julienne cute.
Shred the imitation crab meat.
Mix the cucumber, carrot, and imitation crab meat in a bowl.
Add your desired Kewpie Mayonnaise and Sriracha sauce to the mixture.
Mix well and add tobiko on top.
Serve!
